newsitem.title: USA: MGM unveils partnership for Detroit casino.
newsitem.headline: MGM unveils partnership for Detroit casino.

text.p: MGM Grand Inc, the hotel and gambling company based in Las Vegas, on Wednesday unveiled plans to partner with a group of Detroit community and business leaders to pursue a casino license in that city.

MGM Grand also said its bankers have agreed to boost the company's credit line to $1.0 billion from the current $600 million, giving it the ability to finance a hotel/casino in Detroit and continue expansion in Las Vegas and Atlantic City.
The local group partnering with MGM Grand is currently comprised of nine business, civic and community leaders.

"We are prepared to bring to the people of Detroit and to the State of Michigan an emotionally engaging facility that will attract tourists from the Midwest region, Canada, and from throughout the world," MGM Chief Executive Officer Terrence Lanni said in a statment.
MGM will not finalize its project plans until after requests for proposals (RFPs) have been issued by the city.
"It would be premature at this time to propose specific plans for the project," Lanni said.
